On a very special day for the granny, it will be shown why the unpredictability of an event gives a new value to the young man´s presence in the house.","popularity":3.086,"poster_path":"/fG1l0RdlR5AJWZtvAKL89aQF6jF.jpg","release_date":"2022-11-18","title":"Mamita","video":false,"vote_average":9.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/mJwobBAtVJnj2ruyt75uLIw64IZ.jpg","genre_ids":[18,14],"id":395550,"original_language":"en","original_title":"Crocodile Dreaming","overview":"Crocodile Dreaming is a modern day supernatural myth about two estranged brothers, played by iconic Indigenous actors David Gulpill and Tom E. Lewis. Separated at birth, they have different fathers. One is readily accepted as a full-fledged member of the tribe and is looked on to fulfill the duties of jungaiy, an important ceremonial role which obliges him to be caretaker for his mother's dreaming, the crocodile totem. The other, whose father was white, is younger and has had to struggle to fit into the tribe who see him only as a yella fella.","popularity":1.18,"poster_path":"/h9Oftt0M9ukyVGDSbusd3eo1enf.jpg","release_date":"2006-01-01","title":"Crocodile Dreaming","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[18,16],"id":395559,"original_language":"en","original_title":"You Take Care Now","overview":"You Take Care Now, an early student film, is a perfect exemplar of Ann Marie Fleming's idiosyncratic vision and stands as one of her signature works. Made on 16mm, and incorporating found footage, original material, animation, and processed images (Vancouver's groundbreaking avant-garde cinema of the 1970s is a decided influence here), Fleming's film offers a visually dazzling, emotionally wrenching, oddly humorous account of two profound personal traumas.","popularity":1.301,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"1989-01-01","title":"You Take Care Now","video":false,"vote_average":8.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[18],"id":395636,"original_language":"fr","original_title":"Opale plage","overview":"A mother and her two daughters cross the banks of the North in search of a beach where the elder daughter left her best memories.","popularity":1.357,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2010-11-25","title":"Opale plage","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[14,9648],"id":866494,"original_language":"fr","original_title":"Les Princesses font ce qu'elles veulent","overview":"A poetic and nightmarish dive into the deranged mind of a psychotic little girl. Nina has two secrets, she has freed Tony the Monster who lives in the magical cave and she has just killed her parents.","popularity":2.403,"poster_path":"/sdVW5afMyR3AW5wNeSkO8I73QDt.jpg","release_date":"2021-09-10","title":"Princesses Do as They Please","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/n7devztj32boZRI9DlM9u2HxCAV.jpg","genre_ids":[18],"id":1029724,"original_language":"es","original_title":"My Pana","overview":"Pana is a popular world from Venezuelan slang that means many things: as a noun it refers to a friend, a good person; as an adjective, it’s a positive quality, someone nice, someone friendly and enjoyable. A coming-of-age story, the short My Pana is also a tale of immigration and exile, a portrait of a teenager adapting to a new society with the few tools he knows to survive: his youth, his body and, ultimately, his own resilience. Through the point of view of a teenager we’ll understand the hardships of million of Venezuelans abroad and the consequences of corruption, exile and the fractured soul of a person who was pushed to leave his true life to adapt to a hostile new place.","popularity":8.358,"poster_path":"/5NjC4scIXGFe3wFx7PbOO6bNb2p.jpg","release_date":"2023-03-18","title":"My Pana","video":false,"vote_average":2.0,"vote_count":1},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":null,"genre_ids":[18],"id":395484,"original_language":"en","original_title":"The Irrational Fear of Nothing","overview":"The camera lingers over the back of a lonely New Yorker who ponders his own existence, his fears and fear of fears.\r Shot with an Olympus E-M5 Mark II as part of a film series to promote the camera system.","popularity":1.34,"poster_path":null,"release_date":"2016-04-30","title":"The Irrational Fear of Nothing","video":false,"vote_average":0.0,"vote_count":0},{"adult":false,"backdrop_path":"/z3EXxKDckWOsBomVCSxyXAroiOv.jpg","genre_ids":[18],"id":551191,"original_language":"no","original_title":"She-Pack","overview":"Anarchy emerges at a public pool birthday party when a group of small girls push the limits of their strength and power.
